intro: Campanula thunbergii, commonly known as the bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to East Asia. It features upright stems that bear clusters of bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are typically hairy and covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Campanula thunbergii is valued in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
